intro: Senefeldera macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf senefeldera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 cm in length. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in the summer months. Native to the mountainous regions of South America, it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental addition to gardens and natural habitats.
